Adventure.name: The Call of the Wild
Adventure.description: Jack London's classic adventure novel following Buck, a dog who is torn from his comfortable life and thrown into the harsh wilderness of the Yukon.

Adventure.name: Treasure Island
Adventure.description: Robert Louis Stevenson's timeless tale of pirates, treasure, and adventure on the high seas as young Jim Hawkins seeks to discover the treasure of the infamous Captain Flint.

Adventure.name: Moby-Dick
Adventure.description: Herman Melville's epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt down the great white whale, Moby-Dick, which explores themes of fate, vengeance, and the human spirit.

Adventure.name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
Adventure.description: Mark Twain's coming-of-age story about Huck Finn as he floats down the Mississippi River with Jim, an escaped slave, encountering adventure, danger, and moral dilemmas.

Adventure.name: Into the Wild
Adventure.description: Jon Krakauer’s exploration of Chris McCandless, a young man who abandons his conventional life and ventures into the Alaskan wilderness in search of freedom and self-discovery.

Adventure.name: The Secret Garden
Adventure.description: Frances Hodgson Burnett's beloved story of Mary Lennox, a young girl who discovers a hidden, magical garden and transforms her life and the lives of those around her.

Adventure.name: The Swiss Family Robinson
Adventure.description: Johann David Wyss’ story of a Swiss family shipwrecked on a deserted island, and their efforts to survive and thrive in an unfamiliar wilderness.

Adventure.name: The Lost World
Adventure.description: Arthur Conan Doyle’s adventure novel set in a South American plateau where prehistoric creatures still roam, as a group of explorers venture into the unknown.

Adventure.name: Around the World in Eighty Days
Adventure.description: Jules Verne's tale of Phileas Fogg, who bets that he can circumnavigate the globe in just 80 days, embarking on an adventure filled with danger and excitement.

Adventure.name: The Jungle Book
Adventure.description: Rudyard Kipling's iconic collection of stories about Mowgli, a young boy raised by wolves in the jungles of India, and his adventures with various animal friends and foes.

Adventure.name: Life of Pi
Adventure.description: Yann Martel’s adventure of Pi Patel, a young boy who survives a shipwreck and is stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger for company.

Adventure.name: Robinson Crusoe
Adventure.description: Daniel Defoe’s classic novel of survival and adventure, following the story of Robinson Crusoe, a man stranded on a deserted island for 28 years.

Adventure.name: The Black Stallion
Adventure.description: Walter Farley’s story about a young boy, Alec Ramsay, who befriends a wild stallion while stranded on a desert island, leading to a life-changing adventure.

Adventure.name: The Odyssey
Adventure.description: Homer's ancient Greek epic, following Odysseus' long and perilous journey home after the Trojan War, filled with fantastical creatures and trials of will.

Adventure.name: The Count of Monte Cristo
Adventure.description: Alexandre Dumas’ thrilling tale of Edmond Dantès, a man wrongfully imprisoned who escapes and seeks revenge against those who betrayed him.

Adventure.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
Adventure.description: Jules Verne's classic science fiction-adventure novel about a daring expedition to the earth's core, where they encounter strange and mysterious underground creatures.

Adventure.name: The Grapes of Wrath
Adventure.description: John Steinbeck’s Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about the Joad family’s struggle to survive during the Great Depression as they travel west in search of a better life.

Adventure.name: King Solomon's Mines
Adventure.description: H. Rider Haggard’s adventure story about Allan Quatermain, a Victorian explorer who embarks on a perilous expedition in search of a lost diamond mine in Africa.

Adventure.name: The Old Man and the Sea
Adventure.description: Ernest Hemingway’s powerful story of an old fisherman’s battle with a giant marlin, exploring themes of perseverance, struggle, and the human condition.

Adventure.name: The Road
Adventure.description: Cormac McCarthy's gripping post-apocalyptic tale of a father and son struggling to survive in a desolate world, offering a profound look at humanity and hope.
